mmj.tmff

Class TMFFStateParams

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmj.tmff.TMFFStateParams

  • public class TMFFStateParams
extends java.lang.Object
    TMFFStateParams holds the state data used throughout processing in the TMFF rendering code.

      • currLineNbr

        public int currLineNbr
        currLineNbr is used internally and need not be set by programs calling TMFF. It refers to the line number within a formula (1, 2, etc.)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TMFFStateParams

        public TMFFStateParams(java.lang.StringBuilder inSb,
                       int inPrevColNbr,
                       TMFFPreferences tmffPreferences)
        Standard constructor for TMFFStateParams.

        You are responsible for setting reasonable values. No validation is performed. See previous constructor for additional information.

        Parameters:
        inSb - is the input StringBuilder. All output is appended to this StringBuilder. It must be pre-initialized.
        inPrevColNbr - is the column number on the current print line of the most recently output character. Set it to 0 if nothing has been written to the current line, or to the previous character's position (1, 2, etc.)
        tmffPreferences - - current TMFFPreferences.

    • Method Detail

      • appendTokenAtGivenPosition

        public int appendTokenAtGivenPosition(java.lang.String token,
                                      int pos)
        Puts token to string buffer with at least one space following previous output character.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to append
        pos - the screen column at which to draw the token
        Returns:
        -1 if error, else 0.

      • padSBToGivenPosition

        public void padSBToGivenPosition(int pos)
        Outputs spaces to prepare for output of a token at a given column. If necessary performs a line break using either NewLine, or extra spaces when in LineWrapOn mode.

        Pads *thru* the given position! I.E. if you say pad to column 7, then column 7 ends up containing a space.

        Parameters:
        pos - the screen column at which to draw the token

      • setSB

        public void setSB(java.lang.StringBuilder sb)

      • setPrevColNbr

        public void setPrevColNbr(int prevColNbr)

      • setLeftmostColNbr

        public void setLeftmostColNbr(int formulaLeftCol,
                              int useIndent,
                              int proofLevel)
        Updates TMFFSP leftmost column number using the TMFFPrefences formulaLeftCol and indent amount parameters plus the level number of the formula within the proof.

        If indentation is used, based on variances between different proof steps, then this routine needs to be invoked every time, just before calling tmffPreferences.renderFormula(). That is because the TMFFPreferences.formulaLeftCol is not updated and must be used to reset the value of TMFFSP.leftmostColNbr after each use. 

         setLeftmostColNbr(formulaLeftCol + (useIndent * proofLevel));
        NOTE: If the resulting leftmost column number is not less than the rightmost column number, the indentation is turned off: 
         setLeftmostColNbr(formulaLeftCol);
        Parameters:
        formulaLeftCol - from TMFFPreferences or other.
        useIndent - indent column amount per proof step level
        proofLevel - step formula level number within proof

      • newlineSB
